channel.title: Dan Haywood
channel.description: domain driven design, apache isis, restful objects, naked objects, agile, tdd

item.title: Jekyll, github and asciidoc - oh my!
item.description: Having used Wordpress to host my blog for the last few years, I thought it was time to get in with the cool kids and instead host my blog on github pages, using Jekyll.

item.title: An adapter to use Hamcrest matchers as AssertJ conditions
item.description: Following on from yesterday’s post on AssertJ, here’s a tiny github repo that I put together with some utilities for AssertJ.

item.title: Converting from Hamcrest to AssertJ
item.description: Don’t quite know how I missed it all these years, but I only recently discovered AssertJ. So I’ve started to use it in some of the Isis Addons example apps, for example the todoapp.

item.title: [ANN] Apache Isis version 1.8.0 released
item.description: We just pushed another release of Apache Isis, and it’s a big one! New features in this release include:

item.title: Welcoming Martin Grigorov as a new committer on Apache Isis
item.description: Martin Grigorov is now a committer and PMC member of Apache Isis.

item.title: [ANN] Apache Isis version 1.7.0 Released
item.description: We just pushed out Isis 1.7.0, which consists of:

item.title: Configuring Apache Isis command profiling and auditing module add-ons
item.description: When v1.6 of Apache Isis was released a month or two back we also announced the creation of a new “add-ons” website as a place to hold reusable module of code for any Apache Isis app.

item.title: [ANN] Apache Isis version 1.6.0 Released
item.description: Apache Isis 1.6.0 has been released, including new and improved event bus stuff to decouple business logic within the apps, and a new companion www.isisaddons.org for housing third-party modules.

item.title: [ANN] Apache Isis version 1.5.0 and related components Released
item.description: The Isis team is pleased to announce the release of:

item.title: [ANN] Apache Isis 1.4.0 released
item.description: After 4 months development, we’ve just released Apache Isis 1.4.0, and supporting components.
